School of Architecture

CARNEGIE MELLON UNIVERSITY

WHERE ART & TECHNOLOGY
MEET PRACTICE

The School of Architecture provides deep immersion in the discipline of architecture, intensified by the broader Carnegie Mellon culture of interdisciplinary innovation and creative inquiry.

Latest news

Featured
Apr 20, 2019
Students
inter•punct Call for Submissions: Pedagogy Zines
Apr 20, 2019
Students

inter•punct is putting together a project discussing emergent and often radical issues latent in the educational environment that the organization feels are far too absent from current discourse. Following the footsteps of pamphlet architecture, clip-stamp-fold, and 'a few zines,’ the group is curating a collection of zines, and they invite you to be a part of this process.

Apr 20, 2019
Students
Apr 19, 2019
Events
Brad Samuels Uses Architectural Forensics to Tackle Human Rights Issues
Apr 19, 2019
Events

Brad Samuels of New York-based SITU demonstrates how architectural approaches to research and investigation can shed new light on issues of social impact and human rights. He presented his research work during the 2019 SoA Spring Lecture Series.

Apr 19, 2019
Events
Apr 19, 2019
Students, Alumni, Research & Programs
Alumna Carolina Tamayo (B.Arch ’17) Wins 2019 John Stewardson Memorial Fellowship in Architecture
Apr 19, 2019
Students, Alumni, Research & Programs

The SoA congratulates alumna Carolina Tamayo (B.Arch ‘17), winner of the 2019 John Stewardson Memorial Fellowship in Architecture, and Elizabeth Levy (B.Arch ‘19), a top ten finalist. The Stewardson Fellowship is the oldest and most prestigious award for architecture students and graduates in Pennsylvania.

Apr 19, 2019
Students, Alumni, Research & Programs
Apr 18, 2019
Events, Students, Faculty
Announcing the Winners of the 2019 SoA Design Awards
Apr 18, 2019
Events, Students, Faculty

Congratulations to the winners of the 2019 SoA Design Awards, and thank you to all of those who participated in this year’s competitions and joined us for the awards reception presented by EPIC Metals.

Apr 18, 2019
Events, Students, Faculty

LECTURE SERIES Updates

Featured
Apr 2, 2019
Events
Final Spring 2019 Back2Front Session is Wed 03 April
Apr 2, 2019
Events

All are invited to join us to discuss the recent ACSA lectures and events on Wednesday 03 April at 4:30pm in MMCH 203 for the semester’s final Back2Front session. We'll be joined by guests Christoph Eckrich, Kai Gutschow, and Ray Ryan (curator of the Heinz Architectural Center).

Apr 2, 2019
Events
Apr 1, 2019
Events
Kipp Bradford Proposes Radical Strategies for Combating the Effects of Global Climate Change
Apr 1, 2019
Events

The School of Architecture welcomed Kipp Bradford on Monday 28 January for the first installment of the 2019 Spring Lecture Series. Bradford presented the radical strategies he believes will be required to both minimize and manage the impacts of climate change.

Apr 1, 2019
Events
Mar 28, 2019
Events, Faculty, Alumni, Students
ACSA National Meeting in Pittsburgh March 28-30 Features SoA Faculty, Alumni, and Students
Mar 28, 2019
Events, Faculty, Alumni, Students

The 2019 ACSA National Meeting takes place in Pittsburgh Thu 28 - Sat 30 March. We invite you to attend the presentations, panel discussions, and keynotes featuring SoA faculty, alumni, and students. All events take place downtown at the Westin Pittsburgh Hotel, unless otherwise noted.

Mar 28, 2019
Events, Faculty, Alumni, Students
